meanings.definition: To bend low with the limbs close to the body.
meanings.sent1: The cat was crouching behind the sofa.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys crouching to pet small animals.
meanings.sent3: The crouching squirrel looked like it was playing hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The crouching lion was ready to pounce on its prey.
meanings.sent5: Crouching makes you feel like a sneaky spy.

meanings.sent1: The detective was crouching to examine the footprints.
meanings.sent2: People often crouch when picking up something from the floor.
meanings.sent3: The crouching toddler tried to reach the cookie jar on the counter.
meanings.sent4: The crouching gardener carefully planted the seeds in the soil.
meanings.sent5: Crouching helps you avoid hitting your head on low ceilings.

meanings.definition: To lower the body close to the ground by bending the legs.
meanings.sent1: The athlete was crouching at the starting line.
meanings.sent2: Hunters often crouch to stay hidden from their prey.
meanings.sent3: The crouching frog leaped into the pond with a splash.
meanings.sent4: The ninja was crouching silently in the shadows.
meanings.sent5: Crouching is essential for a good defensive stance in sports.
